column5: A few buddies of mine went out trout fishing the other day and were really succesful. Allthough they would not tell me what they were using for bait. They admitted it was not minnows or corn, and said they would not tell me until I guess it correctly.  Can anyone share their ideas as to what they might have been using. It is organic...  Thanks
worms, maggots, waxxies, single salmon eggs?
I'm thinking Gulp product if organic.... power eggs, fish fry, 1" black shad just to name a few..... You can also use salmon eggs garlic flavor on a #4 Octopus hook Leechman

It isnt salmon eggs, worms, or maggots... It isnt gulp...  I think its something that isnt sold as fish bait. Something very unconventional...  I asked if it could be found in the grocery store and they said yes...lol
Shrimp

i've heard of shrimp being used for salmonids..never specks though but who knows!  there is no secret bait for them though... personally i just use minnows and worms... specks have a MAJOR soft spot for leeches and small crayfish as well.  by the sounds of things, your buddies did well because they were on a decent lake on a day that fish cooperated...nothing more, nothing less...
I've read about guys using strips of chicken breast, raw of course, for lakers.  But for this, I'd think it was shrimp also.
x 2  stay away from the canned stuff, get the frozen cooked/uncooked stuff...all you need is enough to barely cover your hook  mysis shrimp is a killer but not well known fly pattern
Shrimp man ! Buy shrimp rings and cut the shrimp in three pieces and tie 4 little single hooks on your line and fish them at different dept its killer!
I've heard that cheeze works.

Its not chicken and its not shrimp!  Their having a real blast watching me break my brain trying to figure it out. I'm pretty sure they aren't pulling my leg either. They said they brought minnows, but they were catching everything on this "secret bait".  I'll have to ask if it was cheese.
Some oily canned fish? Kippers, sardines.
*SMILES*
Only one other thing that would work is oysters.... fish go crazy on them
marshmellows?

Chances are, whatever they were using could have been duplicated by a number of baits on that particular day. There is no magic Brook Trout bait. When they are on, you can throw the kitchen sink at them and catch them by the boat full. When they are off, they can be near impossible to catch. I pretty much fish Brook Trout exclusively and I've caught a few in the past two decades. Not one has been caught on an organic bait.
Smoked sausage?
As correct as you may be, I'm still interested in finding out what they were using. It wasnt cheese, bacon or marshmellows...the quest continues
personally i think your buddies are just "jerkin' your gherkin" if you know what i mean...
Bologna, preferably garlic.
Strip of moose tongue....good luck getting it off the hook after.

I agree with doc. Kick one of them in the pills and then tell the next guy he'll get worse if they don't spill.  We all like to think we have our secret technics, baits, lures and spots. The reality is much different.
Tender Vittles cat food?
